I'm constantly getting lost, and it's not a game where it's fun to get lost. not enough cues, I don't know where I'm supposed to go, or what to do to unlock the right way to go. and the platforming doesn't feel good, as the character is so slippery. ladders are just bad, and too many things go beep beep beep all the time and it's so annoying. tried this because I love Portal/2, and I get this came first but dang, Valve has come a long way. I'm gonna try HL2 and see if I can appreciate that one better. I'm sure this was good for it's time, but it really doesn't feel good to play to me.

Joguei Half-Life pela primeira vez em 2020, então essa review não tem muito bias com relação a nostalgia de jogo, mas devo deixar claro que joguei muito Counter-Strike 1.5/1.6 na infância, que eram inicialmente mods de Half-Life e foram depois desenvolvidos na mesma engine, então os gráficos e a jogabilidade não me eram estranhos ao jogar Half-Life.

Devemos deixar claro também um fato: Half-Life é relativamente feio e datado hoje em dia, mas foi um inovador na área de FPS no tempo de seu lançamento, criando mecânicas e elementos de experiência do usuário que são usados até hoje, como a movimentação em W, A, S, D, botão esquerdo pra atirar, etc. Até mesmo no level design o jogo impressiona pra época, com salas secretas que só quem prestar atenção consegue realmente encontrar e também com puzzles pra avançar na história, que não eram comuns em jogos de FPS da época.

Para quem se importa com a história dos jogos e quer jogar esse jogo pelo valor histórico, ele definitivamente vale a pena. É um jogo difícil sem necessariamente ser frustrante. Entretanto, se os gráficos ou a jogabilidade mais antiga não te agradam, hoje em dia existe uma opção extra se quiser experimentar a essência de Half-Life: o jogo chamado Black Mesa, uma reimaginação de Half-Life com permissão de desenvolvimento da própria Valve.

Раньше был наслышан про данную игру и про вселенную Half Life в целом, решил купить первую и вторую часть данной вселенной. Первая часть мне понравилась, для 1998 года (на минуточку в этом году вышла данная игра) игра просто бомба, в 2021 году ничуть не плохая, наоборот кайфанул от атмосферы, которой пропитана вся игра, взял я по скидке первую и вторую часть так что не жалею своих денег, советую пройти эту часть тем, кто не знает стоит ли начинать проходить или нет. (лучше начинать с первой части, т.к я видел, что первая и вторая часть связанны сюжетом) Спасибо за внимание!:)

Half life was the second fps game i ever played and i loved it then and i love it now but still find lots of problems here and there.Half life when it came out was revoltionary and stuff so first combat. foes or better than the reskins half life 2 had they work well my faverite being the bullsquid but it has problems the human enemys feel a bit overused and the aliens were in low supply of cool ones i think how valve could have fixed it was by adding 4 more aliens 2 in black mesa and 2 in xen. wepeons.2 great one thing half life did that other games dont really do anymore is alt fires that are not wepeon upgrades like the double barrel blast on the shotgun and the tau cannon over charge the guns are great just the pistol gets outclassed once you get the smg with a grande launcher the only 2 wepeons that are kind of pointless are the gluongun or that packs from gost busters and the trip mine the gluon gun is kind of pointless compared to the tau cannon (and by tau i dont mean those things from 40k all i know is that they have to be killed and fast) and i only used the trip mines once or twice. story.3 its not bad it not deep but its told in a type of narative that games should use more unbroken first person persective but aside from that the story is fun not super deep and well its a start for fps. movement.4 the movement is fine some people say your to fast yeah and in halo you carry to many wepeons the movement is good if you can master it (sort of) the levels are great but xen is just a nightmare god awful low gravity with still killer fall damage and the platforming THE PLATFORMING this is the worst part of half life and the hd models unless your playing blueshift do not use them but i dont want to end this on a bad note so YOU CAN BLOW UP DOCTER MAGNASINS casarole and he will not forgive you for 20 years YAY.

服了进去就闪退

A 40/60 split of good/bad respectively, I'd say. When it it's good it's good but more often than not it wasn't, just tedious and frustrating instead.

Pros:
- Surprisingly immersive and interactive world considering the year it was released.
- Rewards caution and sharp senses, the tools and hints you need to succeed are there if you take the time to examine the situation... Usually.
- It's got charm, I cannot deny.

Cons:
- Gordon controls like a drunk with brain damage made of flubber caught in an oil slick at all times. Makes already frustrating first-person platforming so much worse. Even just trying to move with any sort of precision can be all but impossible sometimes.
- Rife with artificially difficult trial-and-error sections and/or portions which call for quick, precise movements that the control your given only technically allows for, if ya know what I mean.
- One of the worst final bosses I've ever had the displeasure of having to slog against.

Honestly the DLC's were better (even Blue Shift.) Better level design with more reasonable challenges.
